column4: hello all: http://www.banja.com/login.asp shows  a flash page. I can click the buttons, but I can't enter text in it. Is this a problem just with my computer?
About http://www.banja.com/login.asp, I _can_ enter text, but it's invisible. What's up?
are you using the "official" flash plugin or the Free one that comes with ubuntu?
how can i check?
how did you install flash?
i forgot.
how can i confirm which flash i have?
open firefox, type "about:plugins" (no quotes) in the addressbar and look for the flash plugin description...tell me what it says
File name: libflashplayer.so    Shockwave Flash 7.0 r25
application/x-shockwave-flash  Shockwave Flash  swf ..
application/futuresplash  FutureSplash Player  spl  Yes
uhm...that's the official one....it shouldn't be all that unstable....then again, I rarely use it, I have an extension blocking display of flash until/unless I want to display it
can you go to http://www.banja.com/login.asp and tell me if you can see the text you enter?
can't see the text, no
you mean you can't see the text that you enter with your keyboard, right?
right, nor in the user nor password fields
so what's wrong?
badly made flash animation would be my guess...they must be using something that is windows-specific
i see. there's no way we can solve this on ubuntu computers, is there?
don't think there is, no
okay. I guess we just have to avoid sites like that.
and send an email to the webmaster telling him why
